intro: Spilanthes grandiflora var. brachyglossa, commonly known as the narrow-lipped prickly lettuce, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its pungent, peppery scent. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Due to its unique appearance and chemical properties, it is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
